    Celerity in the `lorentz` package

Photons

photon.Rd

Various functionality to deal with the 4-momentum of a photon

Usage

is.consistent.nullvec(N,TOL=1e-10)
as.photon(x,E=1)

Arguments

N

Four-momentum to be tested for nullness

TOL

tolerance

x

Vector of three-velocities

E

Energy, a scalar

Details

Returns the four-momentum of a photon.

Author

Robin K. S. Hankin

See also

4mom,reflect

Examples


## A bunch of photons all approximately parallel to the x-axis:
as.photon(as.3vel(cbind(0.9,runif(10)/1000,runif(10)/1000)))
#>       E       p_x          p_y          p_z
#>  [1,] 1 0.9999990 0.0009490501 1.034351e-03
#>  [2,] 1 0.9999995 0.0005628201 7.821751e-04
#>  [3,] 1 0.9999996 0.0001581438 8.338055e-04
#>  [4,] 1 0.9999990 0.0009725380 9.958330e-04
#>  [5,] 1 0.9999998 0.0005769751 1.571259e-04
#>  [6,] 1 0.9999997 0.0002584610 7.267446e-04
#>  [7,] 1 0.9999991 0.0007963222 1.106161e-03
#>  [8,] 1 0.9999999 0.0004428798 6.026695e-05
#>  [9,] 1 0.9999997 0.0005294895 6.220843e-04
#> [10,] 1 0.9999996 0.0007544706 4.627328e-04


## mirror ball:
jj <- matrix(rnorm(30),10,3)
disco <- sweep(matrix(rnorm(30),10,3),1,sqrt(rowSums(jj^2)),`/`)
p <- as.photon(c(1,0,0))
reflect(p,disco)
#>   E        p_x         p_y         p_z
#> x 1  0.3995461 -0.41548363 -0.81715129
#> x 1 -0.9843814 -0.14229964  0.10365332
#> x 1  0.9490027 -0.22339730 -0.22245809
#> x 1  0.8139393 -0.37053610 -0.44744370
#> x 1 -0.9408047  0.08654903  0.32771296
#> x 1  0.9909050  0.07522980  0.11156958
#> x 1  0.2290568  0.97123969 -0.06501103
#> x 1  0.8848882 -0.19712784  0.42203494
#> x 1  0.4471606  0.88311214 -0.14198707
#> x 1 -0.2211036 -0.44007109 -0.87031640

table(reflect(p,disco)[,2]>0) # should be TRUE with probability sqrt(0.5)
#> 
#> FALSE  TRUE 
#>     3     7 

## relativistic  disco; mirror ball moves at 0.5c:

B <- boost(as.3vel(c(0.5,0,0)))
p |> tcrossprod(B) |> reflect(disco) |> tcrossprod(solve(B))
#>           t          x           y           z
#> x 0.7998487  0.5996974 -0.23987959 -0.47178252
